title: Virginia Tech Cycling Classic
description:
Virginia Tech Cycling Classic

The Black Diamond Ranch will host the Road Race on Saturday
540-864-6692
www.theblackdiamondranch.com

Parking and staging areas will be provided
Food and refreshments will be available for purchase at the ranch, featuring premium grass-fed Red Devon beef hamburgers!!!
* Road course is located in an extremely rural area with no direct access to food or water (except for purchase through the ranch). Please plan accordingly
course:
Maggie Valley Road Race

A hilly 15.7 mile loop that features an extended sharp climb halfway though every lap. This challenging course is nestled into the beautiful back-country of Southwest Virginia. The Mens A and B and Womens A Races will end with the grovelling ascent up John\'s Creek Mountain. This climb ramps up over 3 miles to its steepest and most grueling grade near the top.


CRC Criterium

This 3 turn criterium features a short punchy ascent on every lap and has fast wide turns in the Corporate Research Center just South of Virginia Techs campus.
notes:
Road Race
Center line rule is in effect at all times except for the finish. All dropped riders are subject to the rules of the road. After completing the finishing climb, please descend carefully back to staging.

Criterium Primes

MA - 6            WA - 6
MB - 4            WB - 3
MC - 3            WC - 3
MD - 2

Contact info: Jacob Aber, 540.219.8754 jaber91@vt.edu
directions:
To Maggie Valley Road Race
located at The Black Diamond Ranch

From I81, take exit 118, 460 west towards Virginia Tech. Follow 460 west and turn right onto route 42 east in Newport. Follow for approximately 10 miles and turn left onto route 658 towards Craig Springs. Follow for roughly four miles veering right to stay on John’s Creek Mountain Rd. At T turn right on 632 towards Craig Springs and proceed for less than one mile to staging and registration.


To CRC Criterium

From I81, take exit 118, 460 west towards Virginia Tech. Follow 460 west until Southgate drive stoplight. Turn right at stoplight and proceed to 2nd light, Southgate drive. Turn right and follow for .8 miles to race parking and registration on right across from airport.

Go Fast Turn Left - Richmond Track Series
Scout Camp Races
course: 6 mile single track loop through the woods of Camp Hilbert
registration: There is pre-registration via www.runriderace.com and bikereg.com
notes: See registration information to see start times for divisions.

title: VA High School MTB Series
description: Mountain Bike Series for High School and Junior High School students
course: A series of different courses in either parks or on school grounds
registration:
https://www.bikereg.com/Net/18690
Entry to each race is $12.00 if you purchase a season pass (plus you get a free VAHS MTB t-shirt)
Entry to a single race is $15 if you preregister on BikeReg
Race-day registration for a single race is $20
notes: VAHS MTB is open to ANY high school, middle school, or elementary school student who wants to race.  You do not need a team to participate.  Boys and girls will be scored separately for both the individual and team competition.  Prizes will be awarded to the top-3 finishers in each category.  Individual points leaders will receive leader\'s jersey, which they wear in races.
directions:
Apr 2:Forest Hill Avenue, Richmond, Virginia
Apr 9:Blue Ridge School, 273 Mayo Drive, St. George,  Virginia 22935
Apr 20:New Quarter Park
1000 Lakeshead Drive, Williamsburg, VA 23185
Apr 30:Hillindale Park
710 Hillindale Avenue, Harrisonburg, VA 22801
May 11: Miller School, 1000 Samuel Miller Loop, Charlottesville, Virginia

title: Dogwood Dell Mountain Bike Training Series
Chantilly Training Expo

address.street: Fairfax County Police Vehicle Training Facility, 3725 Stonecroft Blvd

description:
Chantilly Training Expo
Saturday, 6 April, 8:30am-3:30pm
Fairfax County Police Vehicle Training Center
Single day, early-season event open to all levels of cycling enthusiasts, novice to experienced, promoting cycling safety and training.  Activities include on-bike handling skills, pace-line & group riding skills, family-friendly bike rodeo and recreational fun rides, and much more.  Local area bike shops & athletic store vendors will be available providing support & guidance on select products & merchandise.
course: The Fairfax County Police Vehicle Training Center is a 1.3 mile closed course, double-lane, wide-shoulder, asphalt track located off Hwy 50 south of Dulles Int\'l Airport in Chantilly.  The track is well-maintained by the Fairfax County Police Academy and is not regularly opened to the public.
registration: Visit USACycling event registration page for registration details
notes: This event is a TRAINING event only; though on-bike handling skills regarding pace-lining and group rides will be presented by more experienced riders, no official race activities will be conducted during this event.
directions: From Hwy 28 (Sully Rd) in Chantilly, take Hwy 50 (Lee Jackson Mem Hwy) west; turn RIGHT at Stonecroft Blvd, take the first RIGHT turn past Avion Parkway.  Follow the signs to Fairfax County Police Vehicle Training Center, park in designated areas as indicated.

title: 2013 Blue Ridge Spring Cycling Power Training Camp
Go Fast Turn Left - Richmond Track Series - Saturd
12 Hours of Lodi Farm
description: 12 Hour MTB Race on tight, windy single track. Primitive, but beautiful camping available.
course: 8.8 mile loop with rolling hills, roots, creek crossings. great for geared AND single speed.
registration:
Solos/Teams:
March 1 - May 1:  $60/$55
After May 1 - race day registration only: $70/$65

Cats:
Solo Male, Solo Male Masters (40+) and Solo Male Clydesdale 200+, Solo Single Speed, Solo Women, Duo Male, Duo Coed, Duo Female, Duo Single Speed, Expert 3 Person, Sport 3 Person, Beginner 3 Person, Single Speed 3 Person, Open (anything goes - if there are 3 teams of a non-existing category, we will add the category to the line up),  High School Cat (Solo M/F, Duo, 3 Person) .
notes:
This is the 16th year of Lodi. The 12 Hours of Lodi race is part of the Virginia Off-Road Series. The race should NOT interfere with any other endurance event this year, so get your teams together and come enjoy some awesome atmosphere and sweet single track. If you have never done an endurance event or it\'s your first time to race the Farm, we guarantee you will have a BLAST! And like many past years, the race will be fueled with amazing prizes by no other than THE BIKE STOP!!! A HUGE thanks to B.O.B.!!! Make sure to check out his store - it is sweet especially with all the renovations that they made!

Three and two person teams and solo endurance riders will race from 10 A.M. to 10 P.M. Saturday, May 4 (this is a NEW race time - we\'ll try it this year - if it sucks, then I\'ll change it back to 12 Noon to Midnight in 2014).  We will set course to provide ~1 hour lap times.  Most complete laps started before midnight wins.  Primitive, but beautiful camping will be permitted on site (BYO water, electricity, etc.).

The timing of this event should make for an awesome weekend of camping and celebrating post race. There will be porta potties - why would you want showers or warmed toilet seats anyway, right?
directions:
I-95 to Exit 130 - Rte. 3 South/East at Fredericksburg.  Proceed ~7 miles, pass under power lines.  Turn left at Hollywood Farm Road (second crossing of SR 601).  Proceed 1 mile.  Do NOT cross RR tracks.  Turn right onto gravel road and follow signs.
For all the GPS addicts: Hollywood Farm Rd. , Fredericksburg, VA, 22405

title: Blue Wheel 40th Anniversary Ride
description:
Rides from White Hall Vineyards led by Monticello Velo Club
for road (10, 25 & 37 miles) and mountain bikes (17 miles)
with route maps provided. Free to register.
Wine tastings offered by White Hall.
Refreshments served after the rides.
Bring a picnic lunch and enjoy the view of the Blue Ridge Mountains.
Open to the public.

title: Cirque Cyclosportive
description: The Cirque Cyclosportive (or “sportive”) is a European-style cycling event sometimes known by its Italian name, gran fondo. A sportive includes a mass-start, multiple route length options, refreshment/aid/checkpoint stations, on-course technical support and SAG wagons, and timed segment(s) of the course.
course:
The Cirque Cyclosportive will make use of the most lightly traveled roads in Loudoun County. Many of these are unpaved and surfaced with gravel. Approximately 50-60% of each of the course options is on gravel roads. This will add to both the challenge and unique nature of this event. The courses all involve significant climbing in the form of short and sometimes steep hills. Often these hills come on the gravel road sections. Please bring adequately low gearing in consideration of this.
 
Route maps and cue sheets will be provided at packet pick-up, and course maps and elevation profiles will be posted at the event website, www.cirquesportive.com
registration: Registration may be completed online at www.cirquecyclosportive.com.
notes:
A standard road bicycle with 700x25 or 28c tires is perfectly suitable for this event. A cyclocross bike also works well, but is not necessary. Mountain bikes are allowed, but will be a slower option. Due to climbing sections on gravel roads, a minimum 39x25 gear is recommended, and compact or triple cranksets are an even better option for those less proficient at climbing.
 
Triathlon/time trial bikes are not recommended for this event. Triathlon handlebars are not allowed (see below). Stout wheels and thicker/heavier tires are recommended. This is not a ride for carbon wheelsets or sub-200g tires.

Please make sure that your brakes/brake pads are in good working order, as there will be some technical sections and downhill turns.
directions: Start and Finish will be located at Foxcroft Park on Catoctin Circle in Leesburg, VA. The park is located 1/4 mi. north of the intersection of Catoctin Circle and the Washington and Old Dominion Bike Trail. Ride your bike to the start!

title: 2013 Air Force Association Cycling Classic-Challenge Ride
Jamestown Gran Fondo
description: The Jamestown Gran Fondo is ideally situated in the heart of Virginia\'s Historic Triangle.  This ride rapidly takes you onto low traffic, country roads where the pavement is nice and the hills are small.  With staggered starts everyone can finish and enjoy BBQ and beer by the water next to the Jamestown Settlement.  Don\'t miss out on this wonderful time of year to be in Williamsburg, VA.
course: The Jamestown Gran Fondo has Century, Metric Century and 30 mile options.  Each distance is fully supported with mechanics and well stocked aid stations.  The Century starts at 7:30AM, the Metric Century at 8:30AM, and the 30 miler at 9AM.  Each of these rides is mostly flat but has some long, gradual climbs (max 125 ft).  The post ride party starts at 11:30AM and goes until 4:30.  Riders get 2 beers and a BBQ plate with their entry with more available for purchase.
registration: Riders can register at www.setupevents.com.  Click on \"other\" events, then you will find the Jamestown Gran Fondo listed on the drop down menu.
notes: There will be 2 timed sections on the Century and Metric Century portions, there will be one timed section on the 30 mile route.  Remember, this is not a race!  All riders are expected to obey all traffic laws, ride single file, and stay to the right as much as possible.
directions:
Williamsburg, VA is conveniently located between Richmond, VA and Virginia, Beach.  
From Richmond:  Take Interstate 64 to exit 234.  Follow route 199 for 8 miles to Jamestown Road.  Turn right on Jamestown Road and proceed 4 miles to turn right into Anniversary Park.
From Virginia Beach/Hampton: Take Interstate 64 to exit 242A, then proceed 5.4 miles and turn left on Jamestown Road.  Proceed 4 miles and turn right into Anniversary Park.

title: RGS Title Reston Town Center Grand Prix
Gran Fondo Alleghany
description: The Gran Fondo Alleghany is a timed, non-competitive ride through Virginia\'s Alleghany Highlands region and featuring three challenging route distances. The ride again features ex-professional cyclist Saul Raisin as our event patron, and proceeds benefit the Raisin Hope Foundation.
registration:
Entry Fees:

Gran Fondo  $75
Medio Fondo $55
Piccolo Fondo $35
 

**Early Bird Prices of $10 off the base entry fee end April 1st.**

Your Entry Fee Includes:

·	Electronic Chip Timing and Results
·	Fully stocked feed zones every 15-20 mi.
·	Mechanical Support on the course
·	Detailed Route Maps and Course Technical Guide
·	Meal Coupons worth $10, redeemable at selected restaurants throughout the region for the entire weekend.
·	Finishers\' medals
·	Equipment and Safety Regulations
Registrations may be completed online at: 
 https://sport-vista.sportngin.com/register/form/249216418
notes:
The Gran Fondo Alleghany Highlands is a ride, not a race. However, it will include a mass start, and is subject to some specific regulations under the permit granted by USA Cycling.

·	All participants must wear a helmet
·	Bicycles may not have motors or wind fairings attached
·	No trailers of any kind are allowed
·	All handlebar ends must be appropriately covered or plugged
·	Tandems and recumbent bicycles are allowed; however riders of these bicycle types will be separately grouped at the start line
·	During the registration process, you will be asked to provide your USA Cycling Road Racing Category, if you possess a USAC license. You do not need to possess a USA Cycling license to participate; but we will be lining up riders by experience/ability level.




Shuttle Service and Bike Valet

For 2013, the route begins in the City of Covington and finishes in Clifton Forge, 10 miles distant. Due to limited parking at the start, and a desire for all riders to participate in the Finish Line Festival, we will be running shuttle busses from a designated parking lot in Clifton Forge to the start in Covington from 6 AM to 7:30 AM on Saturday morning. This year, we will also offer limited shuttle bus service in the afternoon for riders who wish to park at the start in the morning.

Participants who use the morning shuttle bus service are encouraged to make use of our bike valet service in Covington. You may drop off your bike during number pick-up on Friday evening where it will be kept overnight in an armory with armed guardians on site.

There is no additional charge for the shuttle or bike valet services.

Cancellation and Refund Policies

The event will run rain, shine, wind or hail. Only extreme weather conditions (flooding) will result in the event being cancelled. Participants will receive full refund of their entry fee in this unlikely scenario.

Otherwise, no refunds. Registration slots may be transferred to another party with the consent of both parties.

Full details on number pick-up, parking and safety regulations will be available in the Event Technical Manual, which will be posted at the Home Page.

We look forward to seeing you on the start line in Covington on July 13!
directions:
From Interstate 64 (East or West):
1.Take the US-60 W/US-220 N exit, EXIT 16A, toward Covington/Hot Springs.
2.Turn left onto Madison St E/US-60/US-220. Continue to follow US-60/US-220.
3. Turn slight left onto S Monroe Ave/US-60.
4. Turn right onto N McDonald Ave.
5. N McDonald Ave becomes E Main St.
6. 241 E MAIN ST is on the right.
Parking is available on-street and at the Covington Farmer\'s Market.

title: Carytown Bicycle Company Presents the Bryan Park Circuit Race
The Chesapeake Criterium and Virgnia Senior State
Peter Teeuwen Mem Time Trial #2 & VA AGE_GRADED ST
Alpine Loop & Shenandoah Mountain Adventure TRAINING RIDE
description: Training ride/road tour to prepare for the Alpine Loop and Shenandoah Mountain Adventure routes of the 2013 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Riders do not need to be registered for the 'Fondo in order to participate in this event.
course: Riders preparing for the Alpine Loop will complete 85-miles including one mountain climb on un-paved surfaces. Shenandoah Mountain Adventure riders will complete 65-miles and will remain on paved surfaces for the entire ride.
directions: Will be e-mailed to all participants.

title: Conquer the Hill at Miller School of Albemarle
description: Conquer the Hill is Virginia\'s newest mountain bike event held at the scenic Miller School of Albemarle (whose central campus is appropriately referred to as \"the hill\"). Expect a full day of great racing in a relaxing atmosphere. The race is being held the day after Miller School hosts the State Championship race for the Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series, so come out a day early to check out the venue and cheer on the best junior mountain bikers from around the state!
course: 4 miles of sweet, student-built singletrack, challenging climbs, and flowing descents. There are numerous areas to pass as well as plenty of tight, sinuous stretches through dense forests. The course is roughly 40% doubletrack/fireroads and 60% singletrack.
registration: Registration is currently open on BikeReg.com
notes:
Miller School of Albemarle is a private campus and the trails are not open for riding to the general public. If you would like to pre-ride the course, it will be marked and open at the following times:

    Friday, May 10 from 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm

 Saturday, May 11 after all VAHS categories have finished (around 2:30 pm) until 6:00 pm
directions:
The Miller School of Albemarle is located just 15 minutes west of Charlottesville, VA at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

1000 Samuel Miller Loop
Charlottesville, VA 22903

As you reach the top of the main entrance, stay left at the fork and follow signs to parking in the grass field on your left.

title: Fountainhead Mountain Bike Time Trial
description:
The Fountainhead Mountain Bike Time Trial will be run in Fountainhead Regional Park, located in Fairfax Station, VA. The race will begin at 8am. The course is between 5-6 miles long. Each racer begins 2-5 minutes after the previous racers onto the scenic trails of Fountainhead Regional Park. The fastest racer will be determined by their individual time on the course. Event will be sanctioned by USA cycling. A rain date has been set for December 1.

REGISTRATION
REGISTER at www.BishopsEvents.com/events and find the event you are looking for there, along with many more for excellent causes!!!

Directions to Parking
Parking Lot is off of the main road into Fountainhead Regional Park about 50 yards from the Start/Finish Line for both races.

Timing
The race will be timed by Race Packet!

Packet Pickup
Pre-race meetings will begin around 8:45 near the Start/Finish Line. Plan to arrive NO LATER than 8:00-8:15am. PACKET PICKUP IS ONLY ON RACE DAY!

Race Day Registration
There will be race day registration. Participants will need to arrive at 8:00am to get registered for the event. T-shirts sizes can not be guaranteed for race day registers. CASH OR CHECK ONLY (checks made out to Bishop\'s Events).

Competitors
Ages 10 through 100 can compete in this event.

Awards
Awards categories determined closer to race day. Awards will be handed out after the race near the Start/Finish Line.

Refunds
*No Refunds after October 1, 2012

title: CX RVA
description: VACX RVA is the final race of the VACX series.  It is a day containing several races that last between30 minutes and 1 hours.
course: The course is about 1 1/2 miles long and will contain both grass and dirt road sections.
registration: Registration and info will be available on www.runriderace.com and bikereg.com
notes: all races must have an annual or a day license to compete.  Both will be available at the event
directions:
•From Richmond, Virginia - go west on Interstate 64, US Route 250 (Broad Street), or State Route 6 (Patterson Avenue) for approximately 27 miles.
•Route 6 West - From Richmond, take State Route 6 (Patterson Avenue) west past Crozier and the State Farm, to the first traffic light (US Route 522 and Route 634). Turn right (north) on Route 624 to camp.
•From the South via US Route 522 - US Route 5ss connects with US Route 60 west of Richmond. Proceed north on US Route 522. Cross the James River at Maidens. Continue straight through traffic light to Camp on Route 634.
•Via Interstate 64 - Take Interstate 64 to the Oilville exit. Turn south on Route 617 to US Route 250. Turn right (west) on US Route 250. Turn left (southwest) on Route 632, then turn left (southest) on Route 634 to Camp. Note the brown highway signs that lead into camp starting at US Route 250.
•Via US Route 250 - From Richmond, Take US Route 250 (Broad Street Road) west past Oilville to Route 632. Turn left (southwest) on Route 632, then turn left (southeast) on Route 634 to Camp. Note the brown highway signs that lead to camp starting at Route 250 and Route 632 intersection.
